column4: Be careful with that sharp axe
He started to sob uncontrollably
I know more about raising pigs than you do.
He felt angry at the injustice of the situation.
He didn't approach the front door at once.
They had been given an unfair advantage
I couldn't persuade him that she was a liar
I can't lift this box — will you help me please?
When he called me a thief I promptly hit him
Don't pour hot water into the glass or it will crack
Erik starts infant school in September
Bees suck honey from flowers
All that walking has given me an appetite for dinner
Stop trying to stare me
I managed to grab her hand
He gazed dreamily out of the window
She gave a little girlish giggle
I always blush when I speak in public
Stroke the dog if you like, it won't bite
The baby can't feed itself yet
He kept his gaze fixed on the car ahead
Let us adore God for all his works
He waved to the adoring crowds
Don't complain and do as you are told
She answered the telephone rather sleepily
The witch enchanted the princess with magic words
All your troubles will vanish away when he returns safely
Tom makes up stories to amuse his little brother
She wanted to laugh and weep all at once
